website_summaries.verdict: Sleek and stylish functionality at an unbeatable price.
pros: Aesthetically pleasing, modern convenience at an affordable price
Fuss-free rechargeable battery opens up to 30 bottles per charge
Soft grip handle for added comfort
cons: Some issues with overall battery life

website_summaries.verdict: An easy to use battery-operated wine opener in an attractive design.
pros: With its stylish appearance and simplicity of use, this wine opener is among the top contenders
Users report that it holds a charge well and that it is well made
We love that it is attractive enough to display
cons: Some users experienced trouble after only a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: Beware don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I had to change my review here. I bought this product in May and it already is a lemon which is a polite way to put it. It worked well enough for about six weeks but now refuses to open bottles. I say this meaning when you press the down button (which pulls out the cork) nothing happens. No sound, no motion, no nothing. I have this thing fully charged too. I contacted the seller and requested a replacement and have heard radio silence from them.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: help the regular Joe like me make an informed decision
customer_reviews.text: I like to keep a simple on my reviews and only answer what people really care about. I do not do pictures or videos as I have a job and this does not pay my bills, it is just a way to help the regular Joe like me make an informed decision. I do not get free or discounted products for review, you will get my unbiased review of product. Does it work? Yes, I bought this for opening wine bottles and it does not disappoint. Is it easy to use? Yes Pros: Works as intended Cons: None Note: Drink responsibly
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Best $17 I’ve ever spent....after I read the manual!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought mine was broken but I was doing it wrong! 1. Cut the wrapper with the cutter that it comes with (little loop hooked onto the back of the charger stand). 2. PUSH DOWN ON THE WINE OPENER WITH PRESSURE while pressing the down arrow button as you hold the bottle as well. 3. Once the wine opener feels a little loose, that means the cork is out. 4. Remove the wine opener to reveal the open bottle. 5. Press the upward arrow to release to cork. CHEERS!
customer_reviews.author: Yordana.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Wine Opener That I Can't Return
customer_reviews.text: Terrible wine opener. I have tried using this opener twice and it only pulls the cork out half way and I have to use a manual opener to get the cork out. Unfortunately, I'm now told that I can't return the item. Don't buy this. I'll stick with the old fashioned manual opener and save myself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: gatorhon

customer_reviews.title: Broke while in normal use. What do I do to get a replacement?
customer_reviews.text: Was great until it broke in normal use. Please advise if replacement can be made.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD J. FRIEDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest creation ever. I originally saw a bartender use this at a bar and I had to order myself one. I’m ordering another one for my elderly grandmother for her Christmas present because she struggles with opening bottles of wine all the time. Haven’t found out how long it lasts on a single charge but we’ve opened 6 bottles with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Newton

customer_reviews.title: No longer nearly as reliable as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: The last one of these we had died in less than a year, because it would no longer sit squarely on the base and could no longer charge. We looked everywhere for some sort of obstruction, but it seems that something had simply failed inside. Fair enough - it is pretty cheap. We took it to be an anomaly and bought another one. That lasted just a little over three months before failing in the exact same way. Obviously it is now time to switch brands. Too bad. This product, when it was reliable, was a good value. Apparently there's been some cost-cutting or unintended change.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stein

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality of this product
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about 5 months and have opened about 10 bottles of wine. Then it broke and will not work. 10 bottles!!!! Very disappointed in the quality of this product. I should say don't buy it, but I'm not that kind of person. Make your own choice. We may have gotten a bad one. Who knows. I tried calling and had no luck with the company. WOW!!
customer_reviews.author: jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: This opener replaced the same opener that worked great for years. First time we tried using it the screw went into the cork and stopped before pulling the cork out, we thought that the opener just didn't get a proper charge, fast forward five month later and we tried using it again with the same results. Now it's past the return period and we need another opener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died out in a year
customer_reviews.text: Update!!! Ours lasted right about a year before it stopped working. It's super bulky and takes up counter space, and now it's taking up space in the dump! This does the job just fine, but it is really big. Our last one stopped working after 3 or 4 years, but it just plugged right into the wall with a cord on its own. The new one has a stand that takes up a lot of space, and the whole thing seems a bit bulky. I do like that the foil cutter is not attached to the handheld unit because our last one broke off within weeks, and this one is just stored in the base.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alderson

customer_reviews.title: No more struggle to open the wine!
customer_reviews.text: As a senior citizen, opening a bottle of wine can be a challenge using a manual corkscrew. This opener is great. You place it on the bottle with one hand while holding the bottle with the other and press a button. The corkscrew goes into the cork and will stop when it's fully inserted. Press the button again and it will remove the cork from the bottle and then continue until the cork comes off of the corkscrew. So much easier than doing it manually. I've used it at parties and the charge will last between 20-30 bottles. It also comes with a charging stand and a cutter for the paper wrapped on the bottle neck.
customer_reviews.author: CharmY2K

customer_reviews.title: True love does exist
customer_reviews.text: Picture the scene: It's Saturday (after noon), you have discovered a fresh bottle of wine in the fridge and you have absolutely no responsibilities for the day. You go to the drawer to get your corkscrew and your osteoarthritis says, "OH HOLD UP! GO GET YO MAN TO OPEN THIS FOR YOU!" ...except your man is at a friend's house helping install a ceiling fan. The horror. The devastation. But wait! Enter the Oster electric wine opener. All my dreams came true. Simple and sleek design takes up little counter space. It works flawlessly and with ease. Be still, my wine soaked heart. True love does exist.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S.

customer_reviews.title: Oster doesn't honor the warranty
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 3 months, then it stopped pulling corks. I managed to track down Oster's "contact us" and emailed them my problem and receipt. Got a reply saying "Based on the information you provided, please return the item to the place of purchase. Returning to the retailer is the quickest way to begin using your product again and will allow you to select your preferred replacement or exchange." They did not respond to further emails. Of course they know that Amazon has a 30 day return window and does not mediate warranty claims. That is the responsibility of the manufacturer. Oster is just ignoring the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: HPE

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT let this discharge while in use.
customer_reviews.text: This wine bottle opener works well. You have to however make sure to keep it absolutely straight and aligned with the bottle. Also, you would need to hold the bottle steady and the opener would do the rest. The battery lasts a long time. The reason for 3 stars is something entirely different though. DO NOT let the battery discharge while in use. It happened to me once and I had a real tough time taking a cork out from it. You cannot recharge it with a cork stuck in it as well. I was lucky that the cork was not entirely stuck when it discharged.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Panda

customer_reviews.title: Piece of plastic garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product , do not waste your money . it takes forever to charge and its ginormous . Not worth buying it . You cant open bottles unless you mess up the cork bad . Used it once and trying to get rid of it . Using now a simple waiter bottle opener and I am a lot more successful opening it with that .
customer_reviews.author: bmwkathy

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking to open wine bottles with NO effort, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: You're going to love this if you buy it. The unit is about a foot long and has an up/down toggle switch on it. ALso comes with a "foil cutter", which you use first to expose the cork. Next, just press the unit down over the top of the bottle, push the toggle switch down and hold it there. The corkscrew just drills down into the cork and will reverse itself (automatically) and pull it right out! Take the unit off of the bottle and push the toggle switch up. Hold it there until the cork drops off in your hand. If you want a fun gizmo, and something that is actually useful, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Gary122548

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work- Can't return
customer_reviews.text: This does screw into the cork, the easy part of cork removal is covered. Then comes the struggle to pull the thing out. Stick to a regular corkscrew, it is much easier to get leverage on after you screw it into the bottle. Also, after you struggle with this awhile it gets sweaty slick. I busted my elbow up pretty good trying to pull the cork. All 14 of the people present tried and no one could remove the cork with this piece of junk. This is useless and the return policy is NOPE, NEVER.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: A cork mangler, not a bottle opener.
customer_reviews.text: So far it hasn't actually opened a bottle. Sometimes if goes halfway in and stops. If it does go all the way in, it just drills a hole in the cork. These are identical bottles to ones I bought at the same time and easily opened with my waring opener.
customer_reviews.author: Andy U

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still drinking....
customer_reviews.text: In the 4 years we've had this, I have opened numerous bottles. I've also replaced the batteries once. The batteries are not user replaceable, however a tech minded, electro-wizard could do so. There are 3 AA size rechargeable batteries in this unit. My only issue with this is, the corkscrew. It seems to be getting dull, and no replacement. I might be able to sharpen the tip or use a good grade lube to help, but it still opens bottles, just works a little harder.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this opener for about a month and have attempted to open maybe 10 bottles. This opener has not successfully completely removed a single cork. At best, it gets them halfway, allowing me to pull it the rest of the way out with pliers. It does not matter if it is a synthetic cork or an actual cork one. It fails every time. It also does not appear to be user error as two friends have also used it without success.
customer_reviews.author: 40weeks

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims, and does it well
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine about 6mo. Best $18 I have spent on wine. I don't consider it a neg, but the screw will penetrate the entire length of the cork. If that's a thing for you. Arthritis got the best of me with a rabbit corkscrew so I bought this. I bought a second one for a white elephant Last Christmas. The owner of a winery snapped it up and declared it was going home with him . Period. :) The battery held it's charge for at least 10 bttls before I put it back on the charger. I am buying another right now for the motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: Mushroom

customer_reviews.title: I love this product so much, I bought one for my parents.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much, I bought one for my parents. It is easy to use and convenient enough that it doesn't take too much room on the counter. It also comes with a foil cutter to get the foil off the top of the wine bottle. I like how quiet it is when I am using it and the cork comes out whole 98% of the time. I have had a few times the cork has gotten cracked but not sure if it was the wine opener or the wine bottle having a dry cork. It takes the hassle out of opening wine bottles!
customer_reviews.author: ssp

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim when we were trying to open a wine bottle and realize we did not have a corker! This is pretty easy to use, but the buttons are a bit counterintuitive. You press the down button to bring the cork back up and I suppose maybe it's just me, but it took me a little to understand it. Otherwise, this is great, and it pops the cork right out for you!
customer_reviews.author: Yan

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the basics
customer_reviews.text: I have bought all kinds of electric wine openers. I bought my original Oster from a grocery store when it was on clearance. I thought what the hell... if it breaks ... no big deal. It lasted years. Then I thought I would upgrade and bought a high end wine opener from Total Wines. The Total wines opener broke in a couple of months. I’m now back with Oster. I am sorry, I cheated on you.
customer_reviews.author: K Fish

customer_reviews.title: Read other negative reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the negative reviews more carefully. I recently received this and have tried to use it three times. It never worked. I’ve experienced all the problems reported by other reviewers. Bought two manual accessories to replace it, each of which was easy to use and worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: bad connection
customer_reviews.text: This was a cheaper alternative to some of the items I found here, but I guess there's a reason why it was cheap. The connection from the actual opener to the base was very loose and faulty, a design flaw since there's no securing / locking mechanism to make sure the opener fits correctly to recharge. Since it would not recharge, I didn't even get to test it out on a bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: "Wine" didn't I get this sooner???
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell the ease and wow factor of this little opener?? Sleek looking on the counter. Has a small foil cutter on the back of the stand that cuts through the seal with ease. Place the opener on the top of the bottle, push the button and just hold it down. The opener does all the work for you. Corkscrew goes down into bottle, grabs hold of the cork and pulls it out, all while you just hold the button. Then you push the reverse button and it spins the cork right out into your hand for reuse. PERFECT gift for friends, family or yourself (like I did :) ) Don't hesitate, it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBerry

customer_reviews.title: Great opener for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Wish the battery held a charge longer. I find I have to leave it plugged in all the time. Makes opening and retrieving the cork so easy and for the price, I think it's great. This is my second one--first one finally died after 4 years of slight to moderate use. I like it's slim profile, doesn't take up much room on my little bar and it's nice to have the foil cutter right behind the opener in it's own little slot.
customer_reviews.author: trailrider

customer_reviews.title: The Best Corkscrew Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy drinking wine. Over the years I have tried several different types of bottle openers. Hands down, this is my favorite. After removing the foil, you simply place the gadget over the cork and push the button. The corkscrew lowers into the cork and automatically pulls it up and stops. Push the button in the other direction to remove the cork from the corkscrew. It works well on "real" corks and plastic corks. It is rechargeable and will open dozens of bottles between charges. I like mine so much that I have given them as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Grey

customer_reviews.title: These make the best gifts
customer_reviews.text: So I'm not a wine-o ... I don't drink wine, I just seem to date people who do. After watching my girlfriend struggle with corks for ... ages, I joked about buying this for her. To say the least , she was not pleased with my suggestion. A while longer passed and I just bought it for her anyway as a gift. Needless to say , she now loves it and hasn't used any other methods to open her wine since I bought it. Complete success, 10 out of wine opener. Totally recommend it and now I don't have to watch her struggle with the difficult ones!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Life changer
customer_reviews.text: I know what most of you are thinking, ”how hard is it to un-cork a wine bottle the old fashioned way?”. Well, you’d be right, not too hard at all. But have you considered how lame you look when a guest comes over and you pull out the old hand operated, outdated tool? With this baby I’ve been impressing all my guests with the press of a button. This product works great and is perfect for a white elephant gift that you “forget” to bring to the party because after receiving it in the mail you decide, I want this - I’m keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Brown

customer_reviews.title: OSTER Makes Good Stuff...
customer_reviews.text: I leave it sitting on the charger all the time so it is always ready. Once the wife failed to place it on the charger correctly, and it eventually ran out of power and wouldn't work. I determined that it just needed to charge. That's all it took. This little device just works as expected, better than any other I have ever tried. Love it! Someone gave us an upscale Oster Blender 50 years ago for our marriage. Both still work fine. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Kenno

customer_reviews.title: This Product - Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I originally received as a gift from my son when this first came out. I used it so much I really put it through its paces... I even brought it with me to parties and functions..... So when it finally asked to be retired I had to say yes even though I was so sad to say good bye... And Then My son gives me an Amazon gift card for the holiday and Tada I have a new one. Best Product. No Hassel, no struggle of pulling, twisting pulling some more, no broken corks in the bottle.... This is a must have for any wine lover or server.... I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Kassy

customer_reviews.title: I'd been so happy with my first one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a couple of months ago because the one I had for almost 5 years was giving out. I'd been so happy with my first one! This I've used several times now and only once have I NOT had to dig the cork back out of the opener. Most of the time I have to use force even to get the cork out of the wine bottle. I looked for a way to contact the seller, but I've found none. Hopefully this review will catch someone's attention and they can help me with the situation. So, buyer beware - and use immediately after purchasing because the return window closes a month later.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: broke after than 3 month's use - which wasn't heavy use at all
customer_reviews.text: extremely disappointed. I gave this product rave reviews - the first model of this Oster opener I had lasted for years - I used this one tonight to open a bottle of wine and the cork puller made a chunking sound and fell out. The plastic part inside it broke. Amazon says the return window has closed. I beg to differ. I will be pursuing a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Lori T

customer_reviews.title: A must have for easily opening those corked bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Oster wine opener. We bought our original unit over 8 years ago based on a friend's recommendation regarding its durability; and it lived up to its reputation! After being constantly plugged in and in use on a regular basis, the battery is finally showing signs of weakening and having difficulty with harder corks. Plus, the case is showing some signs of being sticky. Over the years we have given numerous friends the same opener and all sing the praises of this unit. It's easy to get spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Oster Cordless Wine Bottle Opener in May, 2019 and in about month and a half it quit working. I spent 3 days trying to get through to Oster customer support (line was always busy). When I finally got through, I was put on hold for an hour at which time I just gave up and hung up. Save yourself a lot of grief and pass on this bad product. When it goes bad, you will be left hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I purchased for my husband as a gift. Def recommend it. Only thing for me was that it came in a strange box packaging instead of the original item packaging. Said it was stress free packaging so idk if i accodentally requested it that way. Anyways my husband was ok with his gift being in such packaging even though did not look too official. The item itself is a must have if you love drinking wine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited about this product. I hate opening wine and pulling out the cork with brute force. This sounded like a dream. And it was a huge disappointment. I think maybe ONE or possible two bottles opened with this thing. All the rest had to be 'finished' with the old fashioned corkscrew. It's a dud. It's so pretty and such a wonderful idea...and it just doesn't seem to have the strength or connectivity to the cork to remove it. Back to the drawing board, fellows.
customer_reviews.author: BeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Can't open my wine
customer_reviews.text: It looks really nice, wasn't expensive or fancy, and perhaps I was mistaken and it's not supposed to open the wine for you. It only pulls the cork out halfway and if that's if you're lucky. Too lazy to return it and besides, it does look pretty slick on my counter. I wouldn't recommend this product though, not if you want to open your wine bottle...
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: Opened a bottle with a super tight cork. Opens regular ones with ease.
customer_reviews.text: I broke a very nice hand wine bottle opener trying to open a particular brand of wine. Extremely tight cork. The screw part broke off... just twisted the metal. Had to destroy the cork on that bottle to get to the goods. Ordered this opener... it opened the next bottle of that same wine. VERY tight cork. It wasnt easy, you could see the gadget was working hard, but it got it open! Yay! It opens normal wine bottles with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Vallery

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mid- October 2018, and already (5 months) it is unable to open bottles having the easiest of corks. Runs, but it just doesn’t have enough torque to even drill down into the cork. Could be the battery (which sits in the charger crasle) is defective and not enough power. And it wasn’t used all that often - just a few times per week. Very disappointed. Will contact manufacturer re warranty.
customer_reviews.author: HEM

customer_reviews.title: 2nd review . Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The Oster Wine Bottle Opener does the job. The Oster is inexpensive compared to other openers of this type. It does have difficulty with some synthetic corks but not many. We've been using it for two months and it is not something that we expect to last for a long time. A great gift for someone that drinks an infrequent bottle of wine. It has a problem when removing the cork as the bottle wants to turn along with the cork so you must grasp the bottle and the Oster at the same time. It also is a little difficult to place back on the charging mechanism. For the price, however, it's more than OK.
customer_reviews.author: steve1942

customer_reviews.title: I so want to love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I so want to love this thing, but we have bought two, and they simply don't last very long. My wife has trouble manually pulling the corks, so we love that this does that effortlessly. However, the batteries appear to be low quality and don't last long. Buy one if you wish, but be prepared for it to last six months to a year before it simply doesn't have the "juice" to pull the cork out of the bottle. I have seen posts that they are not indicated for use with plastic corks, but I haven't found that to be a problem...unless plastic corks somehow wear out the batteries. We're going to try another solution. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Talisman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 12/17 as a backup. I just opened up the box now (9/18) to use it, and was only able to open about 3 bottles of wine before it died on me. Don't bother buying this product - it won't last. I see that it has a 1 yr warranty. I'll have to look at the fine print to see if I can get a replacement. Not sure I want one since they don't last anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Pam MacGray

customer_reviews.title: Attractive but does not work as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I have returned this product, and irritated that had ha to pay for the return since it did not work as described. It is very attractive, and has a great design. BUT that does not make up for the fact that it does not pull the cork fully out of the bottle. I tried it several times, and the result was the same--the cork only was pulled 2/3 out of the bottle. Therefore I had to physically pull it outs. Not what I expected. So I'm going back to the old-fashioned cork puller style.
customer_reviews.author: Badgerette

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product because just like everyone wanted a easier way to open Wine. I tried multiple times at several angles to open the one bottle but to my attempt was unsuccessful. Some reviewers I saw had problems and some, this product workered prefectly. Will continue to try other products maybe another will work unlike this one.
customer_reviews.author: DavinG

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great Wine Bottle Opener
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these in April 2014 for $13.99, and now, 6+ years later, it has finally lost its power to extract a cork from a bottle, so I'm going to immediately order a new one. They now cost $19.99 (a $1.00/year price increase), but I would pay $30 for one of these (don't tell Oster). We drink quite a bit of wine, so I am really pleased with this opener, especially after having paid twice as much for a different brand of opener that stopped working after less than a year, which was when I bought this opener.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Waggles

customer_reviews.title: Great new wine opening option
customer_reviews.text: I am an oenophile and have multiple different wine opening options (corkscrews, rabbits, Ah-So's, etc. I saw this electric opener at a VRBO we rented and was hooked. It is easy to use and very simple. So far (40 bottles), it has worked well. I had one cork from an older vintage break, but was able to fish it out with a two pronged Ah-So. This makes a nice gift for your wine drinking friends.
customer_reviews.author: John Lenihan

customer_reviews.title: BROKE after used on 4th bottle of wine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my friend had hers (exact one) for 16 years! I used it on my 4th bottle of wine and it just stopped working. Was charged but no movement at all. :( There are also certain corks that were a bit thick to fit into the size of the chamber area. I'll be contacting Oyster to find out about warranty. I cannot believe I missed my return window. :(
customer_reviews.author: Joy W. Spradley

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one we bought. I never had any problems with the 1st 2 products. But, this one has caused problems from the beginning. Sometimes the cork will not come out or it gets torn up when it gets stuck. Other times it comes out of the bottle but won't come out of the remover without a knife or a lot of manipulation.
customer_reviews.author: Dede Witherspoon

customer_reviews.title: Plastic outside deteriorates and becomes sticky.
customer_reviews.text: Can't wash it off. The black part on the body has become like sticky tar. It turns your hand black if you pick it up. I called Oster's 800 Customer service number. They were of zero help.
customer_reviews.author: Liz P.

customer_reviews.title: Pop Goes the Bottle
customer_reviews.text: Ok, maybe not pop but let me say out of the gates, this opener works. Since this was purchased a couple months ago this is being used at least once a day, sometimes twice. To be honest it is made of plastic and feels a little less impressive but it works like a charm. Don't get me wrong this is living on the counter as it has a nice look. The hardest part is to ensure you are lined up in the center of the cork as you can't really see it, but no matter it still drives down the screw and pulls it right out. For the price it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Darin J.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift for the lush in your life.
customer_reviews.text: Yes Yes Yes. I bought this for my dad for Xmas, and I honestly can say that I think it is the only present I bought him that he has used continuously even 6 months after Christmas! He uses it daily (not sure what that says about his wine intake) but he loves it thats for sure. Easy to insert, easy to get the cork out, and its rechargeable so you don't have to worry about replacing batteries or cartridges or anything!
customer_reviews.author: Mahina Gina

customer_reviews.title: Greatest. Thing. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: What's better then drinking wine? Being able to open it without killing my hands in the process! I LOVE this wine opener. I bought it back in 2016 and it's still going strong. I would definitely recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Kuehner

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I recently opened the product and threw away the packaging. This is probably the worst product I have bought from Amazon. Doesn't do it's job at all, the spindle doesn't go through the cork properly at all. First I thought I didn't have enough charge so I waited a couple of days but still there is isn't much thrust go through the cork. Please avoid buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh Duttagupta

customer_reviews.title: The first one lasted about 5 years and worked great. Unlike the first opener
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Oster Cordless opener. The first one lasted about 5 years and worked great. Unlike the first opener, the new one doesn't work on the new rubber/silicon corks. It pulls them fine but doesn't eject them without wedging them with something.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The battery will die in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my second wine opener from this brand. I last ordered this 6 months ago and now the battery is dead. You can’t replace the batteries so it’s useless once the batteries go out. The fact this didn’t last more than 6 months and I used less than a dozen times makes it poor quality. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Long

customer_reviews.title: Great opener, will last for years to come!
customer_reviews.text: This wine bottle opener is the bomb! I lost everything to Hurricane Harvey and this is one of the first things I replaced in my kitchen. My first one I had lasted me over 10 or more years. I was so excited to see they still make them and they were available! It is so easy to use and gets the cork out great! Thanks for the fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: T. Easter

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd & best cork remover
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd electric cork remover and by far the best. The 1st required batteries. that was a pain to keep up with, besides weak performance. The 2nd was a Rabbit. It was rechargeable. but I didn't know when it needed a recharge. It broke after a year or so. Maybe I was drinking too much wine. But I only drink for my health. This one always sits in the recharging stand, so I assume it always charged. It operates smoothly & powerfully. It comes with a foil cuter that stores in the stand. It looks real cool being stainless steel and the light on top.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent L Penn

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on our brands of wine with synthetic corks.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if your favorite brand has a synthetic cork. You might get lucky and it will work, but it does not work on neither my husbands brand, nor mine. I gave it 3 stars because I've seen this one work on other wine, and it did fine. I also knew I was taking a chance since it says it may not work on these corks in the description. My neighbor had one that I thought was identical, and hers opened my wine, but it must be a diff model.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Walters

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift! Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. Love the look and foil cutter (bonus) is the best (just pop on, no fiddiling around for arthritic fingers). The height is a perfect fit under countertops etc. I've had no probs with charging and or re-charging. This was a family gift. IMHO It's a bit difficult to hold while the cork unscrews/screws. But that's just me! Great Gift Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Great wine bottle opener!
customer_reviews.text: My friend has an electric wine bottle opener as well. And I bought a battery operated one from a local store a while back...but you can definitely tell we only spent $5 on it. Needless to say, that’s why we bought this rechargeable wine opener. It’s durable, charges fast, works faster, and is all-around great quality, especially considering it was less than $20! It would be an amazing gift, and if I knew more wine drinkers that didn’t already have one, that’s what they’d be getting for Christmas, birthdays and any other gift giving holiday.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hatterick

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews warned about not letting the opener die, as the corkscrew could become stuck in the device with no way to recharge. We've heeded this warning, and charge it overnight about once a week just to be safe. Using the opener is insanely easy, quick, and fun. Hold the down button while securing the wine bottle until you feel the cork pop free. Move device away from the bottle, and push the up button to back the cork off the screw. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Nestissa

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I seldom write a bad review on a product but this is so bad I have to warn everyone. I've had several people try this at our home just to make sure it wasn't me but no one could get the cork out more than half way with several tries. The opener was this way from the start with a full charge. If you buy this product please be sure not to throw out your manual opener because it will be needed. I'm not sure why there are so many good reviews for this product but you may want to read a few of the negative ones before purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead - treat yourself!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for an event with lots of wine as we never really drank enough wine at home to ‘justify’ one, but it is really cool having this and it is so quick and simple. I also just figured they were probably a really expensive luxury, but I was wrong. Very reasonably and very nice and no more cork pieces in the bottle that occasionally would happen.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stabile

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for hard to open bottles!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far! My wife and I always buy Cupcake Moscato d'Atsi and we have gone through 4 or 5 bottle openers trying to open these bottles. Finally decided to try an electric opener for it, and it opened right up. And the included cutter works like a charm also! Have only used it a few times but so far it hasn't failed us yet. Definitely recommend especially if you continue to buy bottles that are pain to uncork.
customer_reviews.author: Shane the Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap but don't let that fool you!
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap but don't let that fool you! I bought this for my bar at work and we open a lot of wine bottles. I got to say this thing is a beast! It takes every cork right out In no time at all! It's amazing! I love that it's rechargeable so you don't have to worry about batteries! The foil remover works great as well. Overall if your looking for something like this buy this one! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Kailey G.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Oster electric corkscrew for a few years and it has performed flawlessly. For the price it is a great deal. However in the last year or so the black backing has begun to soften to the point that my hand gripping the unit comes away with black residue that can only be washed off by heavy scrubbing. Not good. An alert to Oster customer service was ignored. I live in a year round warm weather climate that might have to be factored into the weakness of the item.
customer_reviews.author: WHH

customer_reviews.title: Easy buy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy buy if you are a wine drinker and want power to open your bottle. I think this is an especially thoughtful gift also at a price point that is hard to beat. If you run into an old cork it could get stuck inside and then you have to dig it out but no big deal. Just dig it out. Again, this is a great buy for yourself or a gift.
customer_reviews.author: hhilde

customer_reviews.title: Good Until It Is Not
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Only problem is that after some time, the black part of the device starts peeling off and gets sticky and black all over your hands. I have had 2 now do that to me. Going to find a different product that doesn't do that. After that happens, had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift for your wino friend! They will love it. The price is great for this quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very classy and sleek. Everything about this product is good quality and works great. I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend and he thoroughly enjoys it. It’s a great way to save all your corks as well. They come out perfectly without tearing or breaking so we keep them. My favorite thing about this item was that it’s re chargeable!! No batteries required!! Also comes with the plastic splitter, great add on. I looked at a lot of others on here and these can be really expensive, this one was the perfect price for me and still great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: For years, we have been opening wine with an old school wine opener. There is nothing worse than a broken cork or a rubber cork when you just need that first sip of wine after the longest workday ever. We finally purchased this electric one and it was by far the best $20 we have spent in years. Do yourself a favor and get one.
customer_reviews.author: B Baker

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Take the foil or plastic capsule off the bottle, Put the opener over the center of the cork and push the button down. Don't stop prematurely, don't pull the cork out - just run the extract button until it stops. The cork will be out, and then when you press the button the other way, the cork will discharge from the housing.
customer_reviews.author: B P C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but it only works on real cork
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands and this is such a delight to use instead of having to use muscle power and hand strength that I don’t have to remove corks. However this corkscrew only works on actual cork. If it is a combination of rubber and cork or if it is a rubber cork it will not work that’s why I only gave it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Louanne

customer_reviews.title: Hasn’t worked for me
customer_reviews.text: The low price should have tipped me off, this hasn’t worked for me at all. We had one for years that was great, but when I needed a new one I thought this would be great. I’ve tried using it several times. The first few times on bottles with “rubber” corks. It wouldn’t even pull the cork out enough for me to grab it with a pliers to finish the job. Tonight I tried it on a bottle with a “real” cork thinking that might be better. Same result. Luckily I have an old fashioned, but much more reliable, manual bottle opener. Don’t waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Better than the expensive one that wouldn't open all cork types!
customer_reviews.text: Dislike the cheapness of the material used and look. But it works great!
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA E. COLEMAN

customer_reviews.title: So Simple and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Take the time to fully charge it before using. Then never fight a cork again. Comes with a foil cutter which cuts the top off cleanly. Then set this on top of the bottle and hold the bottom button until it stops. The cork is out with no effort. The hold the top button and let the cork drop in your hand. Works on natural and synthetic cork.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Howard

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorite Products
customer_reviews.text: Do you ever run across certain products in life that you just love and will continue buying over again? This is one of those for me. Easy to use. No fumbling with cork screws or corks that won't come out and fall apart into the wine. I have bought several as gifts. I only charge it every 3-4 months when it starts to sound sluggish. My first one last about 2 years - it didn't actually break it just didn't sound healthy anymore. I bought a replacement and have had that one for about 2 years now without any problems. So, maybe it won't last forever but, for the $15-$20 price tag, I am not complaining!
customer_reviews.author: CWillett

customer_reviews.title: It works i hope it last
customer_reviews.text: I have had electric ones before i paid lots of money for and they crapped out. This one is inexpensive. Keep it on the bottle till it stops making noise not till it just stops moving. And the cork will come out. Honestly it doesn’t seem that sturdy, but for the price I figure if it stops working in a year I won’t care as much. I don’t know about battery life as I always keep mine on the charger.
customer_reviews.author: BKZOE

customer_reviews.title: Big pile of steaming junk
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say do not waste your time. Mine stopped working well after 10 bottle opens. Now I can't even get it to open a bottle unless I slip it 20 bucks and then only if it is on a Sunday every three weeks. It is garbage. You are better off using your old opener than buying this.
customer_reviews.author: mrmcc916

customer_reviews.title: the wine I like uses synthetic corks which this little machine doesn't like

I just have to use a pair of pliers to hold the plastic cork still while the machine backs the screw out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: it will easily drill through the cork.  Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. It is not as easy as I thought it would be to get the cork out. Maybe it was me not using it properly, but I bought it for the sake of getting it cork out easily and effortlessly, but it's not doing it. Time to search for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe T

customer_reviews.title: Works great for an avid wine drinker!

It does punch a whole completely through the cork, but with resealable corks, its not an issue! The best part is that it's rechargeable and comes with a charging station!

Instead of it getting harder and harder to open bottles the more you drink its just as easy every time. Very easy to operate and comes with a tool cutter too.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Not the best I’ve had a number of very similar devices.  This one

customer_reviews.title: didn't last

Reverse the button and it brings out the cork so you can reuse it or dispose of it. Love this device!
customer_reviews.author: Dockie

customer_reviews.title: Time to replace your corkscrew?
customer_reviews.text: I never get these to last more than 2 years. Maybe I expect too much for a $20 machine. Anyway, my last one quit. So I bought this model to replace my last. customer_reviews.title: Be sure to read the manual! A great opener!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sister in law and her husband, after the wife broke their "Rabbit" opener. Sent it to them, didn't hear anything back. Hmm. customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and is still working....

customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.text: Absolutely recommend this opener for any reason you can think of. I’ve been using one of these almost daily in my home now going on five years. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaSteve

customer_reviews.title: Love this wine opener
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best wine opener! Plug it in, use the cutter to peel the label, place th opener on top of the bottle and push the button - and WOHOO the wine is opened. customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good

product_meta.title: Oster Cordless Electric Wine Bottle Opener with Foil Cutter, FFP - FPSTBW8207-S-AMZ, Silver, One
product_meta.description:
Choose from 3 fashionable colors (each sold separately). OSTER CORDLESS ELECTRIC WINE BOTTLE OPENER
CELEBRATE THE MOMENT IN SOPHISTICATED STYLE
There's just something about opening a bottle of wine. The ceremonial quality of removing the cork truly indicates it's time to unwind. Whether relaxing solo after a long day at the office or hosting an intimate dinner soiree or holiday party, Oster's electric wine bottle opener makes it easy to start the evening off in sophisticated style.

EFFORTLESSLY OPENS A WINE BOTTLE IN SECONDS
Designed to fit all traditional wine bottles, the electric wine bottle opener offers the same portable, cordless convenience as other wine bottle openers, but with the added benefit of sleek presentation and fast, effortless performance, opening a bottle in a matter of seconds. Fast, zero-effort cork removal ultimately means more time to spend with guests. Sipping wine, visiting with friends--Oster helps make it happen.

Note: images below are of the Silver model.

OPEN A WINE BOTTLE IN 3 EASY STEPS
Foil cutter removes wine seal. View larger Wine bottle opener penetrates cork. View larger One simple switch removes cork from bottle. View larger SIMPLE PUSH-BUTTON OPERATION
Before removing the cork, any foil seal covering the cork must be removed first. A handy foil cutter comes included making the task quick and easy.

To use the electric wine bottle opener, place it on top of a wine bottle, making sure it remains in an upright position and not at an angle to the bottle. A single operating switch ensures foolproof operation from here. Simply press the lower part of the switch to start. The unit's corkscrew spiral will turn to enter the cork, then it will gradually remove the cork from the bottle, stopping once the cork has been fully removed from the bottle. Lift the electric wine bottle opener away from the bottle, and remove the cork by pressing the upper part of the switch--the spiral turns in the opposite direction to release the cork. Voila. Let the pouring begin.

OPENS UP TO 30 BOTTLES ON A FULL CHARGE
Measuring 2-1/4 inches in diameter by 10-3/4 inches tall, the electric wine bottle opener provides an ergonomically designed, soft-grip handle that fits in the palm of your hand for a firm grip. Other highlights include an LED charging light on the top of the unit and a power indicator light on the base, which offers a small footprint that takes up minimal space on a kitchen counter, bar, table, or buffet. When not in use, return the electric wine bottle opener to its charging base. A full recharge takes about six to eight hours. Fully charged, it can open approximately 30 bottles of wine.

Available in a Silver, Merlot or Champagne finish, the electric wine bottle opener makes a great gift idea for that wine lover on your list. 

Convenient, cordless design with push-button operation and charging base. View larger WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Electric wine bottle opener, foil cutter, charging base, power adapter, user manual

Opens upto 30 bottles on a single charge(6 8 hours); Simple push button operation
Foil cutter for easily removing seals; Comfortable soft grip handle
Sleek, sophisticated design; Recharging base included; UL approved for 110-120 voltage.
